author: Special Correspondent
text:
Members of various political parties taking out a rally in Tiruchi on Monday to condole the death of veteran CPI leader A.B. Bardhan.— PHOTO: A. MURALITHARAN

Members of various political parties took out a silent procession here on Monday condoling the death of veteran Communist Party of India (CPI) leader A.B. Bardhan who died on Saturday.

Workers of the CPI, the Communist Party of India (Marxist), Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam, Tamil Maanila Congress, and the Janata Dal (Secular) took part in the silent march. Organised by the CPI’s urban district unit, the procession started from Puthur Four Road junction and culminated at Kora Street in Woraiyur area where a meeting was held in memory of the departed Communist leader.

A portrait of Mr. Bardhan, the former general secretary of the CPI, was garlanded. CPI urban district secretary K. Suresh, party’s State executive member Indrajith, CPI-M urban district secretary R. Raja, former Mayor Sarubala R. Tondaiman of the TMC, MDMK urban district secretary Somu and John Kumar, a state-level office-bearer of the Janata Dal (Secular), took part in the procession and offered floral tributes.
title: Parties take out silent march in honour of Bardhan
